id: Ten Things that Caught My Eye Today (October 24, 2018)							Ten Things that Caught My Eye Today (October 24, 2018)
paragraph:
National Review1. Please read my Q&A with Melinda Henneberger about her recent visit to Sudan.2. You can watch today’s powerful lunchtime event at Heritage about the life of J. J. Hanson and protecting the vulnerable from physician-assisted suicide here.3. I’ll be moderating a National Review Institute conversation in New York in November about adoption, foster care, and faith-based communities at the Tikvah Fund. Details here.4. About a Human Life Review event I participated in on Monday on pregnancy-care centers.5. A foster-care and adoption success story:6. Helping Low-Income Fathers Form Loving Relationships with Their Children7. On the Masculine Genius8. C. S. Lewis and Aristotle on Civic Friendship9. Kay Hymowitz is always worth reading — here on women-led crusades and #MeToo.10. Jeremy Irons reads T. S. Eliot to you.NR's afternoon roundup of the day's best commentary & must-read analysis.
